result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad M Lattimer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court is not opposed to the probation being served in Marathon County.

miscConds.notes: AODA assessment and compliance with treatment recommendations.

Absolute sobriety.  May not possess or consume alcohol or controlled substances except for any prescribed medications in the prescribed dosages.  May not enter any premises licensed for the sale or service of alcohol.
Mental health assessment and compliance with treatment recommendations.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due with interest. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

2:31 PM - cases called - 19CF89, 21CF142, 21CF143, 21CF345 and 22CF37.  Defendant Chad M Lattimer in court, in custody.  Attorney Daniel Terry Cveykus in court for Chad M Lattimer.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Polzin regarding plea agreement.  Information(s) filed with the Court.  In receipt - waive reading.  Court questions Atty Cveykus/Defendant.  Responses by Atty Cveykus/Defendant.  Waiver of rights and tendering plea.  Waiver free and voluntary.  Defendant advised of the restrictions that go along with the felony conviction.  Factual basis exits for plea.  Found guilty by the Court.  Motion to revoke DEJ in 19CF89 on Count 1 is not contested.  Court grants motion to revoke DEJ.  Joint recommendation.  Statement by Atty Polzin regarding victim rights.  Statement by Atty Polzin/Atty Cveykus/Defendant/Court regarding sentencing.  Post conviction rights given.  

19CF89 - Court orders on Count 1 s/w 3 years of probation with conditions of probation being restitution in the amount of $750.00, absolute sobriety - may not possess or consume alcohol or controlled substances except for any prescribed medications in the prescribed dosages - may not enter any premises licensed for the sale or service of alcohol, AODA assessment and compliance with treatment recommendations, mental health assessment and compliance with treatment recommendations, no possession of any dangerous weapon and cc/sc.  Court is not opposed to the probation being served in Marathon County.  117 days sentence credit. 

21CF142 - Plea to Count 1 is guilty.  Plea to Count 3 is guilty.  Plea to Count 4 is guilty.  Plea to Count 5 is guilty.  Count 2 - DRI.  Court orders s/w 3 years of probation with conditions of probation being absolute sobriety - may not possess or consume alcohol or controlled substances except for any prescribed medications in the prescribed dosages - may not enter any premises licensed for the sale or service of alcohol, AODA assessment and compliance with treatment recommendations, mental health assessment and compliance with treatment recommendations and cc/sc.  Court is not opposed to the probation being served in Marathon County.  

21CF143 - Plea to Count 1 is guilty.  Plea to Count 2 is guilty.  Court orders s/w 3 years of probation with conditions of probation being absolute sobriety - may not possess or consume alcohol or controlled substances except for any prescribed medications in the prescribed dosages - may not enter any premises licensed for the sale or service of alcohol, AODA assessment and compliance with treatment recommendations, mental health assessment and compliance with treatment recommendations and cc/sc.  Court is not opposed to the probation being served in Marathon County.    

21CF345 - Plea to Count 1 is guilty.  Plea to Count 2 is guilty.  Counts 3, 4 and 5 - DRI.  Court orders s/w 3 years of probation with conditions of probation being absolute sobriety - may not possess or consume alcohol or controlled substances except for any prescribed medications in the prescribed dosages - may not enter any premises licensed for the sale or service of alcohol, AODA assessment and compliance with treatment recommendations, mental health assessment and compliance with treatment recommendations and cc/sc.  Court is not opposed to the probation being served in Marathon County.  

22CF37 - Plea to Count 1 is guilty.  Plea to Count 7 is guilty.  Plea to Count 8 is guilty.  Counts 2, 3, 4, 5, and 6 - DRI.  Court orders s/w 3 years of probation with conditions of probation being absolute sobriety - may not possess or consume alcohol or controlled substances except for any prescribed medications in the prescribed dosages - may not enter any premises licensed for the sale or service of alcohol, AODA assessment and compliance with treatment recommendations, mental health assessment and compliance with treatment recommendations and cc/sc.  Court is not opposed to the probation being served in Marathon County.
